disease_info.summary: An epidermoid cyst is a small, slow-growing, benign cyst commonly found on the skin.  When infected, they can become swollen, red, tender, and painful, and may drain pus.  They arise from the epidermis, the outer layer of the skin.
precautions: Keep the area clean and dry.
Avoid squeezing or picking at the cyst.
Follow the doctor's instructions regarding wound care.

medications.notes: Take with food or milk.  Take as needed for pain.

additional_notes: Follow up with Dr. Mallesh in one week if the infection doesn't improve.  The histopathology report confirms the diagnosis of an infected epidermoid cyst. Complete the prescribed course of antibiotics.
